article: The young couple had another quarrel. They were sitting silently when the landlady came in and asked, You don t _ the house any more? He kept silent and she _ shook her head. The landlady began _ the house. After looking around, the landlady screamed, See how you have _ my house? The walls are full of nails! How could I rent it to others? She began looking around her _ room. Four years ago on the wedding night, he felt deeply _ to her, saying, I feel so sorry to you for _ you live in this small room. In the future I will buy our own big house. This tiny room has two nails on the wall next to the door, one for her bag and the other _ . At that time, she threw all her stuffsuch as her bag and umbrella on the _ once she entered the room, staring at the whole _ and feeling terribly upset. Then he began _ more nails into the wall. There were three nails on the left, on which _ his clothes yesterday and four on the right used to _ their wedding photo frame.The landlady started to pull the nails out with a tool. After the nails were _ , the walls were left with countless holes. Suddenly, she felt heartbroken as if she were _ nonstop through these holes. She _ to her feet and exclaimed, Stop removing the nails! We will rent the house _ we buy our own! He gazed at her surprised, and then turned round, tears over his cheek.She _ realized that marriage was like a wall and that all _ and cold wars were like the nails on the wall. _ , when they were removed, only a wall with holes would remain. But if all the nails were still in their own places, the wall was still complete and reliable.
